title: FLOAT Concept Explorer
description: An interactive tool for exploring and visualizing concepts and their relationships.

fullDescription.content: FLOAT Concept Explorer is an interactive tool for exploring and visualizing the core concepts of FLOAT (Floating Linked Ontological Associative Thinking) methodology. It provides a dynamic interface for understanding the philosophical and practical aspects of this knowledge management approach.
The explorer visualizes and explains the seven foundational concepts of FLOAT:

items.title: Heresy as Interface
items.content: Exploring unauthorized protocols as interfaces with forbidden truths

items.title: Identity as Wayfinding
items.content: Understanding the self as a compass forged through wandering

items.title: Knowledge as Recursive Ritual
items.content: True knowledge as that which can be called again ritually and structurally

items.title: Horror as Unstable Epistemology
items.content: The monster as that which breaks your model of knowing

items.title: Liberation Through Breakdown
items.content: Control systems collapsing under recursive self-awareness

items.title: Memory as a Live System
items.content: Memory as ritual architectureâ€”responsive and co-evolving

items.title: FLOAT Itself
items.content: A way of surviving the archive, a rebellion staged in notation

fullDescription.content: The explorer allows users to navigate through these concepts in a non-linear fashion, seeing how they interconnect and influence each other. Each concept is presented with explanatory text, visual representations, and practical applications in knowledge management.

screenshots.alt: FLOAT Concept Explorer showing an interactive visualization of the seven core FLOAT concepts
